Reviews.Title: “Really nice!”
Reviews.Author: MariaNGreece
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel clean and modern enough. Excellent staff very kind and did everything we asked for (changing the sheets, even provide as with some extra). The breakfast was varied, tasty and plentiful. Very convenient close to the most sightseeing (Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Top Capi, Hippodrome etc). Only the rates were different, when we booked the price was 117â‚¬ (for three nights) but when we paid after arriving with the exchange rate being different we paid 123â‚¬. A piece of advice check with the hotel before arriving that the reservation is due because ours (from the site www.booking.com) have been gone! We finally, thank's to the kind owner, found a room next to the reception which I don't recommend because some times it's a little bit noisy. Generally I would recommend this hotel to everyone except elder people or anyone with disability because it hasn't an elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap solution”
Reviews.Author: dynko74
Reviews.Content: Been there for a week, basically it is very cheap solution for Istanbul (35e) , for that price You can have a Break fast on the terrace. It has WiFi and TV in the room. Room by itself is very good for the price You will pay. And about the staff, nice pleasant people. Also the lady who works the is from Holland so she speaks English what is pretty uncommon thing in turkey. And you have a supermarket right below, part of the hotel. ( Same owner).

Reviews.Title: “bad bad bad bad bad bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: faruk y
Reviews.Content: its not good hotel to stay it will be shame to your money if you go this hotel everythings its horrible breakfast restaurant tables its realy bad no any clean rooms are dirty nobody speak inglish even there is no a reception to help the guest its not hotel its just a building the location its to far for all transportatiÄ±on blue mosque hagia sophia topkapi palace its deffÄ±cult to visit and the locatio of the hotel its very dangerous we were much afraid we never advise this hotel to anyyone

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mitand
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel but we were not happy with this hotel they have really bad service breakfast rooms restaurant tables everything its very bad and the hotel location it is not at safer place the street it's dangerous at the night no light everywhere it's dark We never go there again

Reviews.Title: “A great location in the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Dave77
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in December. The manager Mrs. Sofia is very friendly and helpful. She speaks English fluently and really supported us to solve some problems we occurred with the flight company. The location is great: very close (5 minute walk) to Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace and the tram stop. The rooms are standard size (just the bathroom is a little bit tiny) and clean. The breakfast is quite good and served on the 4th floor terrace with a lovely view of Marmara Sea. Rooms are equipped with hair dryer, cable TV, and a high-speed wireless internet connection. There isnâ€™t the elevator but all the hotels in the Sultanahmet area have not elevator. There is a mini market just below the hotel. A nice gift you will find in the room after opening the doorâ€¦a pair of sleepers with the Eski Konak Hotel logo! Great hotel, it worth the value!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: alma_english
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews and I got even better experience than expected. The staff is absolutely fantastic and the owner so helpful and patient. The location is 5 min walk from the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia but on a side street so its not noisy at all. The price of the hotel was the best through booking.com (35 EUR per double room including breakfast). I would recommend this hotel to everyone looking for great location, excellent views, friendly staff, free wifi and great price :)

Reviews.Title: “neat, good location, good price”
Reviews.Author: Ainura_A
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conviniently situated in Sultanahmet area. The room we stayed in was very clean and the size was more adequate than i had expected. I was very happy with the room condition and service quality. The breakfast was basic but sufficient. The furniture and interior were well maintained, and gives you a home feeling, neat and clean. The neighborhood is very good, lots of places to eat. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Lots of thanks to Sophia. We had a free airport pickup as part of the deal, so that turned out to be very convinient. Used the shuttle bus to go back to the airport. Thanks to the staff for organizing a shuttle ride, was quick and good price. The bathroom was a bit nity though, maybe different in other rooms. Otherwise i am happy with the hotel and would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Lea S
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with a friend for 3 days in 2009. The staff were really friendly and always helpful. They even kept breakfast late for us so that we wouldn't have to wake up early. The location is conveniently next to all the major landmarks in Istanbul. I never took a cab and was able to walk everywhere. Especially considering the price, this place was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel and Helpful Management!”
Reviews.Author: Ardementozo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights after a long eight days in the black sea region. The hotel is very close to all historical attractions in Sultanahmet especially Haghia Sophia, The Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and Divan Yolu Street. The service is extremeley good, with people like Sophia and Ahmed along with his charming sister. The breakfast is good and the hotel ensured extreme care for us during our stay, including finding a parking for our van, fixing the A/Cs and providing a room (free of charge) for our several luggages for our late departure to our country despite being a big family group. I would difinitely stay here again If I come back to Istanbul. Thank you very much Eski Konak for the pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: kingdomembracer
Reviews.Content: Super location, very friendly and multi-lingual staff, who took a real interest in our visit and were extremely helpful. Room was clean and decent size, particularly the bed! The hotel had all the facilities we wanted and needed, and the breakfast was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel- Great location, spotless rooms.”
Reviews.Author: turkishraf
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a superb location. The rooms are spotless but a little bit small. All rooms have A/C and satelite TV in English French and German. (and Turkish obviously) The breakfast is excellent. The wifi and roof terrace are lovely. There is a management team of two: The Turk in charge is charming, and honourable The Dutch Lady in charge is extremely helpful and efficient and knows lots. If I had one minor issue it was in the price. Sure Istanbul is now expensive, but $120 was a bit much for this. So... if it is off season- negotiate the price. If they have space, they will do a deal!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, accommodating, trustworthy”
Reviews.Author: carpathianarts
Reviews.Content: We were skeptical that special arrangements made by e-mail would actually work out, but we were not disappointed. The Eski Konak staff (particularly Sofia, the multilingual Dutch day manager) earned our trust to the point that we left luggage there during a side trip of several days to southern Turkey and Rhodes. Although selection of this hotel was made by chance, its location turned out to be perfect and the accommodations fully met our needs. A nice breakfast selection is served in a rooftop location (both open and enclosed seating) on the 4th floor with a lovely sea view, the only downside of which might be the several narrow staircases that must be climbed to reach it. Although it is located in a busy part of Sultahnamet, we had no problems with noise on either the third or first floor. Travelers looking for good value and convenient location to the big three historic destinations (Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, and Topkapi Palace) should consider the Eski Konak unless they cannot manage stairs.

Reviews.Title: “So hot as an igloo...!!!”
Reviews.Author: Zufuhrstr
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 3 nights! What an experience! First of all the hotel is not for handicap persons. The receptionist -very polite- but most of the times was a kid that he just knew how to say "yes" and "wait", so to call someone else that could understand me. I stayed by the reception on the first floor so I had some noise. My room was cleaned only the first day. The towels and bed linen were old! Very old. Full of hols. There was only one socket for your electronics. They were even turning the wi-fi internet connection off at nights!!!! But the real problem was the cold! I have never been in a so cold hotel room. And people trust me, I jave travel alote in my life! I had to sleep with my coat as there were no blankets and I couldn't find someone to explain me the situation. Even a very economic hotel, I wouldn't visit it again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and very good value”
Reviews.Author: leovw
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for one night having found it on the trip advisor website - It was all that I was looking for - Good value, friendly, a nice place in a very good location - A 5 minute walk from the Blue Mosque and the Topkapi Palace. I most definitely would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Cashew002
Reviews.Content: Rooms were a little on the small side but everything else was perfect. Fantastic and knowledgeable staff. Great range for breakfast. Beautiful view. Good quality pillows, mattress and bedding. Hot water every time. Great water pressure. Very clean. Great location. Good wifi connection in room Fantastic for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: QuintenJ
Reviews.Content: This hotel is certainly worth your money, the friendly staff adds a lot of charm to this place, which is nicely located in the Sultanahmet area.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Eski Konak Hotel, Sultanahmet, Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Seljord
Reviews.Content: Note: There are two Eski Konak's in Istanbul. The one we went to is on this adress: AkbÄ±yÄ±k Caddesi, 44 34122 Istanbul, Turkey [--] Great location, lots of nice restaurants in this street, everybody should try out Hayat CafÃ©, a small restaurant with very nice staff, and a chef that plays Saz (Turkish musical instrument). There are also several travel arrangers in the area, that offer guided tours of varying quality. It takes three minutes of walking to get to the blue mosque, Hagia Sofia and all the other major tourist attractions. The breakfast is good, my favourites were yoghurt with honey, and the bread with Turkish cheese. You can sit either inside or outside during the breakfast, and the view from the outside area is a nice view of the sea, and the street with all the restaurants. There are no elevator in the hotel, so I would not recommend it to people with trouble getting up stairs. We had a really great time. 5 nights = 400 â‚¬ or 800 TYL (double room).

Reviews.Title: “bad bad bad”
Reviews.Author: dasddasdeq
Reviews.Content: good location its not comfortable, bad rooms and very very bad service

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: amoydar
Reviews.Content: Very good service. Nice rooms very very clean. Near to most of sightseeings. Good breakfast and nice view on the roof. The best hotel in this budget.

Reviews.Title: “Perfact Location”
Reviews.Author: BTLim
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is just perfect. A 10 minutes walk from sultanahment tram stop amd only 5 minutes walk to Hagi Sophia, Blue Mosque and most Istanbul famous attractions. This is not a proper hotel , only 9 rooms available and have just a very small reception with no lobby area and public toilet. Our double room is at the back of the building on the 3rd floor with no view from window. The room is small but can consider adequate in istanbul. Pretty new furniture, very clean and spotless bathroom .The double bed is small but comfortable and tv with satelite channels ( English) . The breakfast is served on the terrace overlooking the Bophorus, nice view but the breakfast is a bit below par. Typical Turkish breakfast with some cold items . The night view from the terrace was memorable. When we checked out in the morning before our flight late in the evening. we were allowed to leave our luggage and even have a shower at their sister hotel just few steps away despite all their rooms were full. Something you cannot get if you stay in those establish hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: minibreakes
Reviews.Content: I have just spent 3 nights at this hotel, booked through hostelbookers.com. we had no problems with the booking or the payment! the hotel is in a great location and was very warm with central heating,and extremely clean. the breakfast was just what was needed and the staff were very helpful when asked. great location to see all the major sights. If you're looking for a cheap, clean and cetrally located hotel for a trip, this one will fit the bill

Reviews.Title: “Hotel cheating people”
Reviews.Author: costarico777
Reviews.Content: I would like to tell my story about Eski Konak hotel. On 26 january I booked this hotel from site hostelworld.com for april , 2 rooms for 4 persons for 5 days, price for 1 double room was 40EURO . Next day I get confirmation, my credit card have been charged . 3 weeks ago I get this mail from manager of Eski Konak hotel : Your booking which you made via Hostelworld for Eski Konak Hotel has been canceled.As following details below; Check in : 08-April-2009 Check out :13-April-2009 Nights : 5 Rooms : 2 Double room Balance due : 351 Euro The reason of cancellation, Because we just realise that April is containing the Easter and Anzac day.So that time will be too busy,Ofcourse,when is busy here, We update special price for April period. I already have your booking details,And i didn?t cancel yet . If you don't want to me cancel your booking,You must pay extra which is 410 euro .plus 351 euro. Total payment on arrive will be 761 Euro for 5 nights 2 double room. including all taxes,breakfast and internet access. If you accept this agreement your booking will be acceptable. If not i am so sorry i have to cancel your booking. Please get contact to me back as soon as possible So I think its not normal situation, hotel made prices 2 times expensive after I get confirmation for other prices!!!!!! I could understand if Eski Konak hotel would let me to know about wrong prices next day after i get confirmation, but they did do it AFTER 3 WEEKS! And nobody have responsibility about anything! And this hotel â€“ 2stars and I think 80 EURO for room in 2 stars hotel in Turkey is it reasonable price? Is it not TO MUCH?!!!!! I contact with customer service of hostelworld by phone and by mail, this is my mail: Dear customer service! Eski konak hotels management was cancelled my booking XXXXXX with them own! How its could be possible?! I get my booking confirmation 3 week ago and my creditcard have been charged! Who will pay me this money? I have one question: prices on your site are not real? Many Customers have problems like me? AND I GET ANSWER: All reservations made on hostelworld.com are CONFIRMED and they can not be cancelled, under no circumstances, as they are confirmed from us. Also, all the prices that you see online are all real and added by the hotel itself. When a hotel sign up to work with us, they get a special program from which they can update their rooms prices and availability. This hotel unfortunately has cancelled your booking because they have made a mistake on writing the prices for the days you selected (as they said to you, the price should be higher). I have spoken with the owner of this hotel (which is in copy in this email with us) and he will accept your booking only if the price will be higher. If you donâ€™t want to accept that, I do inform you to make another reservation . So I donâ€™t understand: nobody can not cancel confirmed reservation , but they did do it!!! So now of course I will book another hotel and will use normal booking site , for example with booking.com or hotelboard never I didnâ€™t have problems like that!!! But 3 weeks ago I could find much more cheaper prices than now . Just I donâ€™t want other people have problem like me , thatâ€™s why want to tell about my bad experience. Be careful with this hotel and site, may be next time Eski Konak hotels manager will decide to charge for double room in 2 stars hotel 160EUR , Who knows? Its good that I will have travel in april, so I have time to find another hotel. I see now i am not only one, reed other rewiews

Reviews.Title: “Over before it even even began”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi1487
Reviews.Content: We booked this Hotel through Hostel a hostel booking website at a good price of 90 Euros for 3 nights, however 7 weeks prior to leaving they emailed us to say that they had made a mistake with the prices and since it was Easter they were going to make us pay an extra 130 Euros or they would cancel our booking. We found this totally unfair and have since booked another Hostel at the same price we originally booked for. Hostel looked ok but would not be bothered with this one from they way they have treated us!

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi50BayofPlenty
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel listed on a hostel website and we were delighted with it in every way. It is very modern as it has been recently renovated, its clean and the staff are exceptionally friendly and helpful.The breakfast was typically Turkish but very fresh and good coffee too. On a clear day there are great views of the Bosphorous. The rooms are modern and comfortable and we found it quiet at night as there are no nightclubs nearby. The hotel is just down the hill from the Blue Mosque and Agia Sophia. There are lots of restaurants and cafes selling good food at great prices. Definitely the best food we ate in Turkey was in this area. The Grand Bazaar is a ten minute walk away and the Museum of Islamic Art is five minutes walk. This hotel was great value for money, it is small and friendly and the internet is free! I would definitely stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Eski Konak Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Cankurtaran Mahallesi AkbIyIk Caddesi No: 44 | Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34122, Turkey
